name: Aaryan Patel
aboutMe: I build systems that scale. Fluent in C++, Python, and JavaScript, I'm fascinated by distributed architectures, high-performance computing, and AI systems. From optimizing memory management and concurrent processing to designing fault-tolerant distributed systems and training models at scale, I live for the challenge of making complex systems run faster and more reliably. I thrive on solving problems that better the lives of others.

courses.name: Operating Systems
desc: Process and Thread Management - Understanding processes, threads, system calls, context switching, and different types of scheduling algorithms for managing processor time
Concurrency and Synchronization - Principles of concurrency, mutual exclusion, semaphores, deadlock detection and prevention mechanisms
Memory Management Systems - Virtual addressing, address translation, memory management techniques including partitioning, segmentation, paging, and caching strategies
Device and File System Management - Physical device properties, device control, buffering, disk scheduling, file naming, space allocation, and file system implementation strategies
Interprocess Communication - Message passing, pipes, sockets, signals, shared memory, and other communication mechanisms between processes

courses.name: Algorithms
desc: Algorithm Design Techniques - Systematic study of design methods including greedy algorithms, dynamic programming, graph exploration approaches, backtracking, and branch and bound techniques
Algorithm Analysis - Review of divide and conquer approaches, solution of recurrence relations, and analysis of average case and worst case behaviors
Undecidability and Complexity Theory - Introduction to algorithmic reductions, undecidability of the halting problem, polynomial time complexity, and the relationship between P and NP classes
NP-Completeness - Study of polynomial reducibility, NP-Complete problems, and proofs of NP-hardness for various computational problems
Practical Problem Solving - Application of algorithmic techniques to commonly occurring problems in practice with implementation experience and related programming challenges

courses.name: Introduction to Database Management
desc: Relational Data Model and Languages - Fundamentals of relational databases, relational calculus and algebra, SQL DDL/DML, and database query languages including Query by Example (QBE)
Database Design Methodology - Logical data modeling using Entity-Relationship modeling, mapping ER models to relational models, and normalization to Boyce-Codd Normal Form
Database Application Development - Embedded SQL programming, transaction concepts, access granularity principles, and interfaces like ODBC and JDBC
Database Administration and Optimization - Database indexing for performance tuning, views and view management, database security and authorization mechanisms
Advanced Database Topics - Introduction to distributed databases, data warehouses, and data mining concepts
Database System Architecture - Understanding the architecture and internal workings of database management systems and their core components

courses.name: Numerical Computation
desc: Floating Point Number Systems - Understanding floating point representation, round-off error propagation, machine precision concepts, and stability analysis of numerical recursions
Interpolation and Approximation - Polynomial interpolation using Vandermonde matrix and Lagrange methods, cubic splines, B-splines, and applications like scalable fonts

Ordinary Differential Equations - Numerical methods including forward/backward Euler, modified Euler methods, local truncation error analysis, stability, and global error with applications to pursuit problems and disease propagation models
Discrete Fourier Analysis - Fourier series, Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) algorithms including the butterfly method, with applications to JPEG compression, image processing, and signal processing
Numerical Linear Algebra - LU decomposition, pivoting techniques, condition number analysis, QR decomposition, and large-scale applications like Google's PageRank algorithm
Scientific Computing Applications - Practical implementation using MATLAB, vectorization techniques, and real-world examples from engineering, graphics, and financial computing

Covers designing, coding, debugging, testing, and documenting medium-sized programs
Focuses on reading specifications and designing software to implement them
Involves selecting appropriate data structures and control structures
Emphasizes writing reusable code and reusing existing code
Introduces basic performance issues, debuggers, and test suites

courses.name: Computer Organization and Design
desc: Overview of computer organization and performance
Covers basics of digital logic design
Discusses combinational and sequential elements
Explores data representation and manipulation
Introduces basics of processor design and pipelining
Examines memory hierarchies and multiprocessors

courses.name: Foundations of Sequential Programs (Compilers)
desc: Explores the relationship between high-level languages and the underlying computer architecture
Covers basic machine architecture and assemblers
Includes specification and translation of programming languages
Discusses linkers, loaders, and block-structured languages
Examines parameter passing mechanisms and comparison of programming languages

courses.name: Data Structures and Data Management
desc: Introduction to widely used and effective methods of data organization

Covers specific topics like priority queues, sorting, dictionaries, and data structures for text processing

courses.name: Elementary Algorithm Design and Data Abstraction
desc: Builds on techniques and patterns from CS 135, transitioning to imperative programming

courses.name: Designing Functional Programs
desc: Introduction to the fundamentals of computer science through functional programming, emphasizing elementary programming patterns
Exploration of syntax, semantics, and tracing program execution using substitution methods
Coverage of software development practices, including design, testing, and documentation
Study of both linear and nonlinear data structures, with a focus on recursive data definitions
Examination of key principles like abstraction and encapsulation
Analysis of different types of recursion, specifically generative and structural
Contextualization within the historical evolution of functional programming
